thread.title: John Calipari to assist with Breeders' Cup post position draw
thread.title_full: John Calipari to assist with Breeders' Cup post position draw

title: John Calipari to assist with Breeders' Cup post position draw
text:
John Calipari to assist with Breeders' Cup post position draw Posted: Wed 4:35 PM, Oct 14, 2015 / Article John Calipari 
LEXINGTON, Ky. (October 14, 2015) – The Breeders’ Cup announced today that University of Kentucky Men’s Basketball Coach John Calipari will draw post positions for two races at the Rood & Riddle Breeders’ Cup Post-Position Draw at Keeneland Race Course on Monday, October 26. 
The Breeders’ Cup, Thoroughbred racing’s most prestigious international two-day event, consisting of 13 races and $26 million in purses and awards, will be held for the first time at Keeneland in Lexington on October 30-31. 
Coach Calipari will draw the post positions for the $2 million Longines Breeders’ Cup Distaff, for fillies and mares, 3-years-old and up, and for the $5 million Breeders’ Cup Classic, for 3-year-olds and up, which is expected to include Triple Crown winner American Pharoah in the field. Coach Calipari led the Wildcats to the 2012 NCAA Tournament title and was recently inducted to the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame. 
“We’re delighted to have Coach Cal draw this year’s Distaff and Classic, and greatly appreciate the support from UK Athletics,” said Robert N. Elliston, Breeders’ Cup Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer. “It’s terrific that we can bring together two of the greatest sporting traditions of the Commonwealth, majestic Thoroughbreds and UK Basketball, for this year’s World Championships.” 
The Breeders’ Cup Post-Position Draw reception will be held from 5:30-7:30 p.m. ET, in the Maker’s Mark Bourbon Lounge, located at the top of the stretch near the Gate 2 entrance. The draws for the Distaff and Classic will begin at approximately 6:00 p.m. Tickets for the Post-Position Draw are available at www.BreedersCup.com/draw. Tickets are free for the first 2,000 guests who complete ticket application. 
The post position draw for the first 11 Breeders’ Cup races will be held earlier in the day at 1 p.m. in the Keeneland Sales Pavilion.
